intro: Phlegmariurus compactus, commonly known as the compact thamnophyllum, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a dense, cushion-like structure with tightly packed leaves that are often curved and have a distinct midrib. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. This moss is well adapted to humid conditions and is often found in temperate regions with consistent moisture.
